note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE: INDWELLING PLEURAL CATHETER REMOVAL

Patient: Eleanor Rigby (MRN: 9928174)
Date: 08/12/2025
Attending: Dr. McKenzie

Indication: Patient with history of malignant pleural effusion (breast cancer) and trapped lung who had a PleurX catheter placed 3 months ago. Drainage has decreased to <20cc per week for the last 3 weeks. Pleurodesis appears to have occurred spontaneously or fluid production has ceased.

Pre-procedure: Ultrasound shows no significant fluid. Tract is clean. Consent obtained.

Procedure: Local anesthesia (Lidocaine 1%) infiltrated around the cuff site. Dissection performed to free the Dacron cuff from the subcutaneous tissue. The catheter was pulled smoothly without resistance. Purse-string suture placed to close the site. Occlusive dressing applied.

Complications: None.
Disposition: Home.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Removal of PleurX catheter; decreased drainage suggesting pleurodesis.

evidence.primary_indication: Indication: Patient with history of malignant pleural effusion... PleurX catheter placed 3 months ago.

cpt_codes.description: Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff

coding_review.edge_case_reason: Edge-case: simple tunneled pleural catheter removal (32552) used to test pleural catheter family logic and 0-day global handling.

32552.rationale: Removal of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff.

coding_review.note_level_rationale: 32552 correctly captures surgical removal of a tunneled indwelling pleural catheter with cuff; there is no documentation of pleurodesis, thoracoscopy, or separate imaging guidance, so no additional pleural or imaging CPT codes are assigned.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 32552; total_work_rvu=2.53, total_rvu=3.8 (facility).

note_text:
**BRONCHOSCOPY REPORT**
**Patient:** Chen, Wei | **MRN:** 4452109 | **Date:** 03/03/2025
**Provider:** Dr. L. McCoy
**Diagnosis:** Foreign Body Aspiration

**History:** 72yo M with history of stroke and dysphagia, aspirated a chicken bone 2 days ago. Presents with cough and RLL infiltrate.

**Procedure:** Therapeutic Bronchoscopy (Rigid)
**Sedation:** General Anesthesia (ETT)

**Details:**
Rigid bronchoscope introduced. Right mainstem entered. Mucopurulent secretions suctioned from RLL. A jagged bone fragment was visualized wedged in the RLL basilar segments. 

Using optical forceps through the rigid barrel, the object was grasped. It could not be pulled through the glottis easily, so the object and scope were withdrawn en bloc. 

Repeat inspection showed minor mucosal abrasion but no perforation. Airways cleared of secretions. 

**Plan:** Antibiotics for post-obstructive pneumonia. Speech therapy consult.

evidence.primary_indication: History: 72yo M ... aspirated a chicken bone

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with removal of foreign body

coding_review.edge_case_reason: Edge-case: rigid foreign-body bronchoscopy with suctioning and en bloc removal; tests that 31635 is chosen without separate diagnostic bronchoscopy or secretion clearance codes.

31635.rationale: Bronchoscopy with removal of foreign body; suctioning and repeat inspection are included in 31635.

coding_review.note_level_rationale: Rigid bronchoscopy with removal of a chicken-bone foreign body from the RLL is fully documented; secretion clearance and repeat inspection are inherently included in 31635, so no additional diagnostic bronchoscopy or airway clearance CPTs are added.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31635; total_work_rvu=3.42, total_rvu=5.54 (facility).

note_text:
PROCEDURE: Bronchial Thermoplasty (Session 3 of 3)
DATE: 09/15/2025
PATIENT: Sarah Connors (MRN: 881204)
PHYSICIAN: Dr. T. Dyson

INDICATION: Severe refractory asthma.

PROCEDURE: 
General anesthesia. ETT #8.0.
Alair Catheter used.
Target: Bilateral Upper Lobes (RUL and LUL).

Right Upper Lobe:
- Apical: 8 activations
- Posterior: 10 activations
- Anterior: 12 activations

Left Upper Lobe:
- Apical-Posterior: 18 activations
- Anterior: 14 activations
- Lingula: Not treated (treated in session 2)

Total activations: 62. 
Patient tolerated well. No pneumothorax. Extubated to recovery.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with bronchial thermoplasty, 2 or more lobes

coding_review.edge_case_reason: Edge-case: bronchial thermoplasty session with two lobes treated (RUL and LUL); tests correct selection of 31661 vs 31660 and absence of separate lobar add-on codes.

31661.rationale: Bronchial thermoplasty, 2 or more lobes (RUL and LUL treated in a single session).

coding_review.note_level_rationale: BT is performed in two upper lobes during a single anesthetic; this meets criteria for 31661 (2 or more lobes). No additional bronchoscopic therapeutic procedures are documented beyond BT, so 31661 alone is appropriate.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31661; total_work_rvu=4.25, total_rvu=6.32 (facility).

note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT: BRONCHOSCOPIC LUNG VOLUME REDUCTION

PATIENT: Arthur Dent
MRN: 424242
DATE: 11/01/2025

INDICATION: Severe heterogeneous emphysema, LUL predominant. PFTs: FEV1 28%, RV 210%. CT shows intact fissures. Presented for valve placement.

PROCEDURE:
Flexible bronchoscopy via ETT/General Anesthesia. 

1. CHARTIS ASSESSMENT:
   The Chartis balloon catheter was advanced to the LUL bronchus. Balloon inflated. 
   Result: CV Negative (Flow dropped to zero, pressure separation maintained). Fissure integrity confirmed.

2. VALVE DEPLOYMENT (Zephyr):
   Target: Left Upper Lobe.
   - LB 1+2 (Apical-Posterior): Zephyr 4.0 deployed. Good seal.
   - LB 3 (Anterior): Zephyr 4.0 deployed. Good seal.
   - LB 4 (Lingula Superior): Zephyr 5.5-LP deployed. Good seal.
   - LB 5 (Lingula Inferior): Zephyr 5.5 deployed. Good seal.

Total 4 valves placed. Lobar occlusion confirmed. No complications.

IMPRESSION: Successful BLVR of LUL.

evidence.primary_indication: INDICATION: Severe heterogeneous emphysema, LUL predominant.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with bronchial valve(s) placement, initial lobe

coding_review.edge_case_reason: Edge-case: BLVR with Chartis collateral ventilation assessment performed in the same lobe/session; tests bundling of 31634 into 31647 per chartis_bundling policy.

31647.rationale: Bronchoscopy with placement of endobronchial valves, initial lobe (LUL). Chartis (31634) is performed but bundled into the valve placement code when done in the same lobe/session.

coding_review.note_level_rationale: Chartis assessment is performed immediately before Zephyr valve placement in the same LUL; per bundling policy, 31634 is not separately reported, and 31647 alone captures BLVR in the initial treated lobe. No additional lobes are treated, so no +31651 is reported.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31647; total_work_rvu=7.5, total_rvu=12.05 (facility).

note_text:
Fellow Procedure Note

Patient: John Doe (MRN: 555123)
Attending: Dr. Z. Smith
Date: May 5, 2025

Performed standard bronchoscopy via oral route (moderate sedation). Vocal cords normal. 

**EBUS-TBNA:**
Used linear scope. Sampled station 7 (subcarinal) and 4R (right paratracheal). Both small (<1cm) but PET avid. 
- 7: 3 passes, ROSE negative.
- 4R: 3 passes, ROSE negative.

**Peripheral Nodule Assessment:**
Exchanged for thin bronchoscope (P190). Advanced to RUL apical segment. Inserted **Radial EBUS** probe. Visualized lesion - eccentric view (not concentric). Adjusted scope, still eccentric but tool-in-lesion confirmed. 

Performed **transbronchial biopsies** (fluoroscopy guidance) x 5. 
Performed **brushing** x 1.

ROSE: Non-diagnostic / inflammation.

Plan: Await final path. If negative, consider TTNA.

registry_entry.primary_indication: PET avid mediastinal nodes and RUL nodule.

evidence.primary_indication: PET avid mediastinal nodes and RUL nodule.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS sampling, 1-2 nodal stations
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s) (add-on)
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy, 1 or more lobes
Bronchoscopy; with brushing or protected brushings

coding_review.edge_case_reason: Edge-case: combined linear EBUS-TBNA of mediastinal nodes plus radial EBUS-guided biopsy and brushing of a peripheral RUL nodule in a single session; tests EBUS bundling and 31628/31623 co-reporting.

31652.rationale: Linear EBUS-TBNA of 2 mediastinal stations (7 and 4R) supports 31652 for 1-2 nodal stations.

31654.rationale: Radial EBUS for peripheral RUL nodule during the same bronchoscopy, reported as the add-on EBUS peripheral lesion code.

31628.rationale: Transbronchial lung biopsy of the RUL nodule under fluoroscopy.

31623.rationale: Brushing of the same RUL lesion. Often payer-bundled into 31628 when performed at the same site, but retained here as an edge-case example exercising 31628/31623 co-reporting.

coding_review.note_level_rationale: The case combines linear EBUS-TBNA of two mediastinal stations (31652) with radial EBUS-guided sampling of a separate peripheral RUL lesion (+31654), followed by transbronchial biopsy (31628) and brushing (31623). This configuration is intentionally kept fully coded as an edge-case; in real-world billing, 31623 may be bundled into 31628 by some payers when performed at the same site.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31652, +31654, 31628, 31623; total_work_rvu=12.04, total_rvu=18.78 (facility).
